wikipedia_page.main: George Loveden William Henry Parker, 7th Earl of Macclesfield (24 May 1888 – 20 September 1975), of Shirburn Castle, Oxfordshire, was a British peer and landowner. He was among the last to serve simultaneously as Lord Lieutenant of an English county and as chairman of its county council.

response: *George Parker, 7th Earl of Macclesfield, chairman 1937–70'MACCLESFIELD, 7th Earl of', in Who Was Who (London: A. & C. Black); online edition (subscription required) by Oxford University Press, December 2007, accessed 30 November 2011
* George Parker, 7th Earl of Macclesfield (1888–1975), British peer and landowner

response: *1902: Duchess of Buccleuch, J. N. Bigge, George Parker, 7th Earl of Macclesfield, Hon. Edward Lascelles, Hon. Robert Palmer, George Byng, 9th Viscount Torrington, Marquess of Stafford, Lord Claud Hamilton, Hon. Arthur Anson
